definition: Weichang Manchu and Mongol autonomous county in Chengde 承德[Cheng2 de2], Hebei
enclosure/pig pen/hunting ground exclusively kept for emperor or nobility (in former times)
to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
Weichang Manchu and Mongol autonomous county in Chengde 承德[Cheng2 de2], Hebei
Weichang Manchu and Mongol autonomous county in Chengde 承德[Cheng2 de2], Hebei
pinyin: Wei2 chang3 Man3 zu2 Meng3 gu3 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 xian4
containing_words.word: 圍場滿族蒙古族自治縣

sentences.english: At Qing Dynasty, it was a part of Shengjing Imperial Summer Resort.
sentences.chinese: 這樣一座城寨清朝時爲盛京圍場一部分。

sentences.english: The p paddocks will need water.
I made off through harterhouse Yard into Long Lane.
sentences.chinese: 我由察忒豪斯圍場逃到長巷。

sentences.english: Built in 1938, the top-secret bunker was codenamed Paddock.
sentences.chinese: 建於1938年的最高機密地下堡壘代號“圍場”。

sentences.english: The boys were in the compound loafing .
sentences.chinese: 僱工們都在圍場上閒混。

sentences.english: Farmers may want to put up electric fences to inclose enclose grazing areas, called productspaddocks.
sentences.chinese: 牧民可能想要電籬笆以圍住放牧區，這叫圍場。

sentences.english: At the desert compound, Kimberly pleads with Rick to help her escape.
sentences.chinese: 在沙漠圍場，金伯利懇求裏克幫助她逃跑。

sentences.english: Farmers may want to put up electric fences to enclose grazing areas, called paddocks.
sentences.chinese: 農民可能想要圍繞放牧區建起電圍欄，也叫做圍場。

sentences.english: A cock crowed in the compound.
sentences.chinese: 圍場上一隻公雞啼起來了。

sentences.english: At the desert compound Kimberly pleads with Rick to help her escape.
sentences.chinese: 在沙漠圍場，金伯利懇求裏克幫助她逃跑。

sentences.english: The floor of Goat Paddock Crater is covered by sediments deposited since the Pleistocene Epoch.
sentences.chinese: 山羊圍場隕石坑的地面覆蓋着自更新世以來的沉積物。

sentences.english: Farmers may want put up electric fences to enclose grazing areas, called paddocks.
sentences.chinese: 牧民們可能想把牧區用電網圍起來，叫做圍場。

sentences.english: Rabbits cavort in the paddock at dawn and dusk.
sentences.chinese: 黎明和黃昏時，兔子在圍場裏跳躍。

sentences.english: He keeps horses in a paddock behind his house.
sentences.chinese: 他把馬養在屋後的小圍場裏。

sentences.english: The current reigning emperor is fatuous and self-indulgent, he just hunts in the hunting enclosure every day.
sentences.chinese: 現在的皇帝是個昏君，每天只知道在圍場打獵。

sentences.english: Down below, the mare paced the small enclosure and snorted nervously.
sentences.chinese: 母馬在下面的圍場裏踱步併發出緊張的哼聲。
